tap.metadata

Class TAPTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • tap.metadata.TAPTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DBTable, java.lang.Iterable<DBColumn>

    public class TAPTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBTable

    Represent a table as described by the IVOA standard in the TAP protocol definition.

    This object representation has exactly the same fields as the column of the table TAP_SCHEMA.tables. But it also provides a way to add other data. For instance, if information not listed in the standard may be stored here, they can be using the function setOtherData(Object). This object can be a single value (integer, string, ...), but also a Map, List, etc...

    Important note: A TAPTable object MUST always have a DB name. That's why by default, at the creation the DB name is the ADQL name. Once created, it is possible to set the DB name with setDBName(String). This DB name MUST be UNqualified and without double quotes. If a NULL or empty value is provided, nothing is done and the object keeps its former DB name.

    Version:
    2.0 (02/2015)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS;ARI)

    • Field Detail

      • columns

        protected final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,TAPColumn> columns
        List of columns composing this table. Note: all columns of this list are linked to this table from the moment they are added inside it.

      • foreignKeys

        protected final java.util.ArrayList<TAPForeignKey> foreignKeys
        List of all foreign keys linking this table to others.

      • otherData

        protected java.lang.Object otherData
        Let add some information in addition of the ones of the TAP protocol. Note: This object can be anything: an Integer, a String, a Map, a List, ... Its content is totally free and never used or checked.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TAPTable

        public TAPTable(java.lang.String tableName)

        Build a TAPTable instance with the given ADQL name.

        Note: The DB name is set by default with the ADQL name. To set the DB name, you MUST call then setDBName(String). The table type is set by default to "table".

        Note: If the given ADQL name is prefixed (= it has some text separated by a '.' before the table name), this prefix will be removed. Only the part after the '.' character will be kept.

        Parameters:
        tableName - Name that this table MUST have in ADQL queries. CAN'T be NULL ; this name can never be changed after.

      • TAPTable

        public TAPTable(java.lang.String tableName,
        TAPTable.TableType tableType)

        Build a TAPTable instance with the given ADQL name and table type.

        Note: The DB name is set by default with the ADQL name. To set the DB name, you MUST call then setDBName(String).

        Note: The table type is set by calling the function setType(TableType) which does not do anything if the given table type is NULL.

        Parameters:
        tableName - Name that this table MUST have in ADQL queries. CAN'T be NULL ; this name can never be changed after.
        tableType - Type of this table. If NULL, "table" will be the type of this table.
        See Also:
        setType(TableType)

      • TAPTable

        public TAPTable(java.lang.String tableName,
        TAPTable.TableType tableType,
        java.lang.String description,
        java.lang.String utype)

        Build a TAPTable instance with the given ADQL name, table type, description and UType.

        Note: The DB name is set by default with the ADQL name. To set the DB name, you MUST call then setDBName(String).

        Note: The table type is set by calling the function setType(TableType) which does not do anything if the given table type is NULL.

        Parameters:
        tableName - Name that this table MUST have in ADQL queries. CAN'T be NULL ; this name can never be changed after.
        tableType - Type of this table. If NULL, "table" will be the type of this table.
        description - Description of this table. MAY be NULL.
        utype - UType associating this table with a data-model. MAY be NULL
        See Also:
        setType(TableType)

    • Method Detail

      • getFullName

        public final java.lang.String getFullName()

        Get the qualified name of this table.

        Warning: The part of the returned full name won't be double quoted!

        Note: If this table is not attached to a schema, this function will just return the ADQL name of this table.

        Returns:
        Qualified ADQL name of this table.

      • isInitiallyQualified

        public final boolean isInitiallyQualified()

        Tells whether the ADQL name of this table must be qualified in the "table_name" column of TAP_SCHEMA.tables and in the /schema/table/name field of the resource /tables.

        Note: this value is set automatically by the constructor: "true" if the table name was qualified, "false" otherwise. It can be changed with the function setInitiallyQualifed(boolean), BUT by doing so you may generate a mismatch between the table name of TAP_SCHEMA.tables and the one of /tables.

        Returns:
        true if the table name must be qualified in TAP_SCHEMA.tables and in /tables, false otherwise.
        Since:
        2.0

      • setInitiallyQualifed

        public final void setInitiallyQualifed(boolean mustBeQualified)

        Let specifying whether the table name must be qualified in TAP_SCHEMA.tables and in the resource /tables.

        WARNING: Calling this function may generate a mismatch between the table name of TAP_SCHEMA.tables and the one of the resource /tables. So, be sure to change this flag before setting the content of TAP_SCHEMA.tables using JDBCConnection.setTAPSchema(TAPMetadata).

        Parameters:
        mustBeQualified - true if the table name in TAP_SCHEMA.tables and in the resource /tables must be qualified by the schema name, false otherwise.
        Since:
        2.0

        public final void setDBName(java.lang.String name)

        Change the name that this table MUST have in the database (i.e. in SQL queries).

        Note: If the given value is NULL or an empty string, nothing is done ; the DB name keeps is former value.

        Parameters:
        name - The new database name of this table.

      • setSchema

        protected final void setSchema(TAPSchema schema)

        Set the schema in which this schema is.

        Warning: For consistency reasons, this function SHOULD be called only by the TAPSchema that owns this table.

        Important note: If this table was already linked with another TAPSchema object, the previous link is removed here, but also in the schema (by calling TAPSchema.removeTable(String)).

        Parameters:
        schema - The schema that owns this table.

      • addColumn

        public final void addColumn(TAPColumn newColumn)

        Add a column to this table.

        Note: If the given column is NULL, nothing will be done.

        Important note: By adding the given column inside this table, it will be linked with this table using TAPColumn.setTable(DBTable). In this function, if the column was already linked with another TAPTable, the former link is removed using removeColumn(String).

        Parameters:
        newColumn - Column to add inside this table.

      • addColumn

        public final TAPColumn addColumn(java.lang.String columnName)

        Build a TAPColumn object whose the ADQL and DB name will the given one. Then, add this column inside this table.

        Note: The built TAPColumn object is returned, so that being modified afterwards if needed.

        Parameters:
        columnName - ADQL name (and indirectly also the DB name) of the column to create and add.
        Returns:
        The created and added TAPColumn object, or NULL if the given name is NULL or an empty string.
        See Also:
        TAPColumn.TAPColumn(String), addColumn(TAPColumn)

      • addColumn

        public TAPColumn addColumn(java.lang.String columnName,
                  DBType datatype,
                  java.lang.String description,
                  java.lang.String unit,
                  java.lang.String ucd,
                  java.lang.String utype)

        Build a TAPColumn object whose the ADQL and DB name will the given one. Then, add this column inside this table.

        Note: The built TAPColumn object is returned, so that being modified afterwards if needed.

        Parameters:
        columnName - ADQL name (and indirectly also the DB name) of the column to create and add.
        datatype - Type of the new column's values. If NULL, VARCHAR will be the type of the created column.
        description - Description of the new column. MAY be NULL
        unit - Unit of the new column's values. MAY be NULL
        ucd - UCD describing the scientific content of the new column. MAY be NULL
        utype - UType associating the new column with a data-model. MAY be NULL
        Returns:
        The created and added TAPColumn object, or NULL if the given name is NULL or an empty string.
        See Also:
        TAPColumn.TAPColumn(String, DBType, String, String, String, String), addColumn(TAPColumn)

      • addColumn

        public TAPColumn addColumn(java.lang.String columnName,
                  DBType datatype,
                  java.lang.String description,
                  java.lang.String unit,
                  java.lang.String ucd,
                  java.lang.String utype,
                  boolean principal,
                  boolean indexed,
                  boolean std)

        Build a TAPColumn object whose the ADQL and DB name will the given one. Then, add this column inside this table.

        Note: The built TAPColumn object is returned, so that being modified afterwards if needed.

        Parameters:
        columnName - ADQL name (and indirectly also the DB name) of the column to create and add.
        datatype - Type of the new column's values. If NULL, VARCHAR will be the type of the created column.
        description - Description of the new column. MAY be NULL
        unit - Unit of the new column's values. MAY be NULL
        ucd - UCD describing the scientific content of the new column. MAY be NULL
        utype - UType associating the new column with a data-model. MAY be NULL
        principal - true if the new column should be returned by default, false otherwise.
        indexed - true if the new column is indexed, false otherwise.
        std - true if the new column is defined by a standard, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The created and added TAPColumn object, or NULL if the given name is NULL or an empty string.
        See Also:
        TAPColumn.TAPColumn(String, DBType, String, String, String, String), TAPColumn.setPrincipal(boolean), TAPColumn.setIndexed(boolean), TAPColumn.setStd(boolean), addColumn(TAPColumn)

      • hasColumn

        public final boolean hasColumn(java.lang.String columnName)

        Tell whether this table contains a column with the given ADQL name.

        Important note: This function is case sensitive.

        Parameters:
        columnName - ADQL name (case sensitive) of the column whose the existence must be checked.
        Returns:
        true if a column having the given ADQL name exists in this table, false otherwise.

        An iterator over the list of this table's columns.

      • getColumn

        public DBColumn getColumn(java.lang.String colName,
                 boolean byAdqlName)
        Description copied from interface: DBTable
        Gets the definition of the specified column if it exists in this table.
        Specified by:
        getColumn in interface DBTable
        Parameters:
        colName - Name of the column (may be the ADQL or DB name depending of the second parameter).
        byAdqlName - true means the given name is the ADQL name of the column and that the research must be done on the ADQL name of columns, false means the same thing but with the DB name.
        Returns:
        The corresponding column, or null if the specified column had not been found.

      • getColumn

        public final TAPColumn getColumn(java.lang.String columnName)

        Search a column inside this table having the given ADQL name.

        Important note: This function is case sensitive.

        Parameters:
        columnName - ADQL name of the column to search.
        Returns:
        The matching column, or NULL if no column with this ADQL name has been found.

      • hasColumn

        public boolean hasColumn(java.lang.String colName,
                boolean byAdqlName)

        Tell whether this table contains a column with the given ADQL or DB name.

        Note: This functions is just calling getColumn(String, boolean) and compare its result with NULL in order to check the existence of the specified column.

        Parameters:
        colName - ADQL or DB name that the column to search must have.
        byAdqlName - true to search the column by ADQL name, false to search by DB name.
        Returns:
        true if a column has been found inside this table with the given ADQL or DB name, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getColumn(String, boolean)

      • getNbColumns

        public final int getNbColumns()
        Get the number of columns composing this table.
        Returns:
        Number of its columns.

      • isEmpty

        public final boolean isEmpty()
        Tell whether this table contains no column.
        Returns:
        true if this table is empty (no column), false if it contains at least one column.

      • removeColumn

        public final TAPColumn removeColumn(java.lang.String columnName)

        Remove the specified column.

        Important note: This function is case sensitive!

        Note: If some foreign keys were associating the column to remove, they will be also deleted.

        Parameters:
        columnName - ADQL name of the column to remove.
        Returns:
        The removed column, or NULL if no column with the given ADQL name has been found.
        See Also:
        deleteColumnRelations(TAPColumn)

      • deleteColumnRelations

        protected final void deleteColumnRelations(TAPColumn col)
        Delete all foreign keys having the given column in the sources or the targets list.
        Parameters:
        col - A column.

      • removeAllColumns

        public final void removeAllColumns()
        Remove all columns composing this table. Foreign keys will also be deleted.

      • addForeignKey

        public final void addForeignKey(TAPForeignKey key)
                         throws TAPException

        Add the given foreign key to this table.

        Note: This function will do nothing if the given foreign key is NULL.

        WARNING: The source table (TAPForeignKey.getFromTable()) of the given foreign key MUST be this table and the foreign key MUST be completely defined. If not, an exception will be thrown and the key won't be added.

        Note: If the given foreign key is added to this table, all the columns of this key will be linked to the foreign key using either TAPColumn.addSource(TAPForeignKey) or TAPColumn.addTarget(TAPForeignKey).

        Parameters:
        key - Foreign key (whose the FROM table is this table) to add inside this table.
        Throws:
        TAPException - If the source table of the given foreign key is not this table or if the given key is not completely defined.

      • addForeignKey

        public TAPForeignKey addForeignKey(java.lang.String keyId,
                          TAPTable targetTable,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> columns)
                            throws TAPException

        Build a foreign key using the ID, the target table and the given list of columns. Then, add the created foreign key to this table.

        Note: The source table of the created foreign key (TAPForeignKey.getFromTable()) will be this table.

        Note: If the given foreign key is added to this table, all the columns of this key will be linked to the foreign key using either TAPColumn.addSource(TAPForeignKey) or TAPColumn.addTarget(TAPForeignKey).

        Returns:
        The created and added foreign key.
        Throws:
        TAPException - If the specified key is not completely or correctly defined.
        See Also:
        TAPForeignKey.TAPForeignKey(String, TAPTable, TAPTable, Map)

      • addForeignKey

        public TAPForeignKey addForeignKey(java.lang.String keyId,
                          TAPTable targetTable,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> columns,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          java.lang.String utype)
                            throws TAPException

        Build a foreign key using the ID, the target table, the given list of columns, the given description and the given UType. Then, add the created foreign key to this table.

        Note: The source table of the created foreign key (TAPForeignKey.getFromTable()) will be this table.

        Note: If the given foreign key is added to this table, all the columns of this key will be linked to the foreign key using either TAPColumn.addSource(TAPForeignKey) or TAPColumn.addTarget(TAPForeignKey).

        Returns:
        The created and added foreign key.
        Throws:
        TAPException - If the specified key is not completely or correctly defined.
        See Also:
        TAPForeignKey.TAPForeignKey(String, TAPTable, TAPTable, Map, String, String)

      • getForeignKeys

        public final java.util.Iterator<TAPForeignKey> getForeignKeys()
        Get the list of all foreign keys associated whose the source is this table.
        Returns:
        An iterator over all its foreign keys.

      • getNbForeignKeys

        public final int getNbForeignKeys()
        Get the number of all foreign keys whose the source is this table
        Returns:
        Number of all its foreign keys.

      • removeForeignKey

        public final boolean removeForeignKey(TAPForeignKey keyToRemove)

        Remove the given foreign key from this table.

        Note: This function will also delete the link between the columns of the foreign key and the foreign key, using deleteRelations(TAPForeignKey).

        Parameters:
        keyToRemove - Foreign key to removed from this table.
        Returns:
        true if the key has been successfully removed, false otherwise.

      • removeAllForeignKeys

        public final void removeAllForeignKeys()

        Remove all the foreign keys whose the source is this table.

        Note: This function will also delete the link between the columns of all the removed foreign keys and the foreign keys, using deleteRelations(TAPForeignKey).

      • deleteRelations

        protected final void deleteRelations(TAPForeignKey key)
        Delete the link between all columns of the given foreign key and this foreign key. Thus, these columns won't be anymore source or target of this foreign key.
        Parameters:
        key - A foreign key whose links with its columns must be deleted.

        public java.util.Iterator<DBColumn> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<DBColumn>

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • copy

        public DBTable copy(java.lang.String dbName,
           java.lang.String adqlName)
        Description copied from interface: DBTable

        Makes a copy of this instance of DBTable, with the possibility to change the DB and ADQL names.

        IMPORTANT: The given DB and ADQL name may be NULL. If NULL, the copy will contain exactly the same full name (DB and/or ADQL).
        And they may be qualified (that's to say: prefixed by the schema name or by the catalog and schema name). It means that it is possible to change the catalog, schema and table name in the copy.
        For instance:

        • .copy(null, "foo") => a copy with the same full DB name, but with no ADQL catalog and schema name and with an ADQL table name equals to "foo"
        • .copy("schema.table", ) => a copy with the same full ADQL name, but with no DB catalog name, with a DB schema name equals to "schema" and with a DB table name equals to "table"
        Specified by:
        copy in interface DBTable
        Parameters:
        dbName - Its new DB name. It may be qualified. It may also be NULL ; if so, the full DB name won't be different in the copy.
        adqlName - Its new ADQL name. It may be qualified. It may also be NULL ; if so, the full DB name won't be different in the copy.
        Returns:
        A modified copy of this DBTable.
